Posts.Content: stexas wrote: I went in for a 3 D mammogram this month that night I received a call from my drs office and I was able to review my report online. The report said: There is a 1.3 cm irregular density mass with an indistinct margin in the right breast at 11:00 posterior depth 9 cm from the nipple. They suggested a second 3 D mammogram with closer up images and a ultrasound those were performed this week. The radiologist came in the room to talk to me and scanned my breast again after the tech did it. He showed me the mass and said it was small which meant it was found early but since it has indistinct margins and blood flow these make it concerning for cancer. I sensed a bit of urgency in his voice to get my biopsy set up. He said that the imaging showed NO node involvement. My biopsy appointment is next week. I honestly was not expecting this so I did not ask a lot of questions at the time. The report from those two test should be available for me to view by tomorrow. I find I can pick apart the reports better by reading them. My grandmother had a mastectomy and I have no idea what type of breast cancer she had this has been many years ago. My mother which was her daughter had a lumpectomy and I have no idea what kind hers was I never asked. That is the only breast cancer I know of in the family but both my mothers brothers had prostrate cancer. My dad had prostrate cancer and esophageal cancer and his mom had brain cancer. I appreciate any information anyone can provide and for some reason the thing that scared me the most on all this was the fact it had blood flow. Dx 12/1/2017, DCIS/IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 2, 1/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Still testing stexas stexas

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2017 07:21AM stexas wrote: Both sides of my family are screwed in the cancer department. Do they do a lot of blood work type stuff if you do have cancer? I have been going through some gastro testing & the radiologist asked me to put it on hold for now and concentrate on the breast findings. The abdomen ultrasound showed a polyp in the gallbladder that is 2mm. The bile duct had a small echogenic 3mm focus within the cbd without associated acoustic shadowing. I have learned I have diverticulitis and my esophagus is spastic and requires being stretched out while doing a EGD to check out the bile duct issue. I have been having choking issues so this was part of the reason for this gastro testing. I was in the middle of all this when my mammogram appt. came up and now I am on hold until the biopsy.

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2017 11:30AM - edited Nov 25, 2017 11:37AM by stexas I have the ultrasound report. Findings are different size is that normal and locations a little different? Findings: There is a 1.6cm x 1.3cm x 1.2cm round mass with indistinctt margin in the right breast at 11:00 posterior depth 6 cm from the nipple. This round mass is of mixed echogenicity. This correlates with the mammography findings. Color Flow immaging demonstrates that there is increased vascularity. No other suspicious finds are seen within the right breast. No lymphadenopathy in the axillary or internal mammary chains was identified. Impression: HIGHLY SUGGESTIVE OF MALIGNANCY ( this was in all caps just like this) BI-RADS 5 Highly Suggestive of Malignancy

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2017 04:01PM - edited Nov 24, 2017 04:02PM by stexas Georgia1, I am assuming your from Georgia by your name I am from Texas as you can tell by my name. I have tried pretty hard not to jump to conclusions but the mind starts wandering and here comes GOOGLE. I really want to see those reports tomorrow I thought it was today and was so upset when I realized it was tomorrow. It is like they hold them 5 days so the Dr has time to get in touch with you first. Funny thing is I talked to the radiologist at the ultrasound so I know the basics just not the details it might list. I am sure since my primary care dr ordered the first test that led to the other test she will be the one to call me with results of the biopsy. If it is bad then I start the next steps finding a surgeon and a oncologist. My mother had the testing done and it came back negative at the time she was quite relieved to know she would not pass breast cancer on to us. We just have so much cancer in our family. Thank you for replying.

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2017 08:15PM stexas wrote: I am sorry you breast surgeon was not listening and answering your questions. I saw the oncologist on Monday who I loved he spent 1 hr talking to me and answering all my questions. Tuesday my hormone test were back. I was ER,+ PR+ HER2- . Yesterday I went in for the Oncotype screening, blood work and did the tumor marker blood work. I am a 3rd generation breast cancer so there should be no issues with the insurance covering this testing. Today I am meeting with the radiologist and then next Tuesday the surgeon. It seems things are moving along pretty fast for me and the hope is to have surgery before the holidays.
